column5: I was wondering if any of you guys could help me find a place in Barrie to get my auger blades sharpened.  Can you sharpen them yourself or do you need a machine?  Thanks for the help  Swany
I dont of anyone here.I would suggest buying replacements.
Would be interested in the same thing, is it easier to just buy replacements?
You could buy one of These and do it yourself.  Or buy a new set or use fish307's blade exchange.
You know Dave.. the number of times this gets asked that would pay for itself in no time...

step 1, buy a second set of blades. step 2, buy a "skate stone". step 3, use the skate stone on old blades to sharpen like you would a knife.  That's how I kept my manual auger blades sharp.  You only sharpen the angled side.
O.K. Wayne you talked me into it I am going to buy one of the Sharpeners and set up a local business and just watch the money roll in.... Thanks for the incentive to become my own boss.   Art
There's a place in Orillia that does them, "Rockey's"  pretty sure it's been mentioned before here. Rockey's Tackle Repair  705-325-3526

There is a guy over on blake street across from the care dealer Schmidt and Shaw who can do it. His business is in a little white store.  Just before Blake turns into Penetanguishene rd. near the home hardware store.  He was ill a few years ago but I think he is still in business.
Great info guys, I need to get my blades done as well for my power auger.
